name: Seated Hip Adduction
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you.
2. Bring your toes together and let your knees relax, keeping them slightly bent if necessary for comfort.
3. Slowly lift both legs up and away from your body, squeezing your glutes at the top as you adduct your hips.
4. Hold this contraction for a brief moment to emphasize the gluteal activation, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
5. Continue repeating the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Seated hip adduction is an isolation exercise targeting the gluteus medius muscle in the hips, performed by lifting legs up and away from the body while seated on the floor.
